dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So Apple, right? They, like, secretly hired a bunch of hackers to take down GrayShift's tech. Wild, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, actually, that's not quite how it went down. Apple itself, you know, they just kind of completely eliminated GrayKey's ability to do anything.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not magic, but, um, it's pretty brutal. Sources say Apple installed this internal kill switch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though its clear Apple has locked GrayShift out, no one actually knows just how the iPhone maker has done it. Vladimir Katalov, chief of forensic tech provider Elcomsoft, has repeatedly uncovered weaknesses in Apple technology. But he was stumped too. No idea.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A kill switch? What does that even mean for GrayKey?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A kill switch? What does that even mean for GrayKey?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so apparently, when GrayKey connects now, it, uh, it instantly fries the phone's internal memory. Just bricks it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so apparently, when GrayKey connects now, it, uh, it instantly fries the phone's internal memory. Just bricks it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On those devices, GrayKey can only do whats called a partial extraction, sources from the forensic community said. That means police using the tool can only draw out unencrypted files and some metadata, such as file sizes and folder structures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So it can't even, like, brute force anymore? I thought that was their whole thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So it can't even, like, brute force anymore? I thought that was their whole thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, GrayKey used brute forcing techniques to guess passcodes and had found a way to get around Apples protections preventing such repeat guesses. But no more.

dialogue_turns.text: It used to be. It found a way around Apple's protections, but, uh, no more. Now it just shows an error message.

dialogue_turns.text: Man, no wonder that police captain from Rochester was so mad, saying Apple's working with cartels.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Police officer Captain John Sherwin of the Rochester Police Department in Minnesota said of the claim iOS 12 was preventing GrayKey from unlocking iPhones: Thats a fairly accurate assessment as to what we have experienced. Give it time and I am sure a workaround will be developed ... and then the cycle will repeat.
